content:
Yes, besides food, Kedah has many other exciting things to offer visitors. Here are a few recommendations:

1. Langkawi Island: Langkawi is an archipelago of 99 islands in Kedah located in the Andaman Sea. It is famous for its stunning beaches, clear blue waters, and lush rainforest. Visitors can go sailing, scuba diving, trekking or simply relax and enjoy the beautiful scenery. 2. Mahsuri's Tomb: This historical site is located in Langkawi and is the tomb of Mahsuri, a legendary figure in Malaysian history. According to legend, she was unjustly accused of adultery and was punished by being executed. Her curse caused the island to suffer from misfortunes for seven generations. 3. Gunung Jerai: This is a famous mountain in Kedah, known for its hiking trails, forests, and waterfalls. Visitors can hike to the summit to enjoy panoramic views of the surrounding landscapes or visit the many waterfalls located on the mountain. 4. Alor Setar Tower: This is a 165-meter-high tower located in the city of Alor Setar, the capital of Kedah. Visitors can go up to the observation deck to enjoy spectacular views of the city and surrounding countryside. 5. Ulu Muda Eco Park: This is a protected rainforest located in the northern region of Kedah. Visitors can go trekking or camping in the forest, observe wildlife, and enjoy the natural beauty of the park. These are just a few of the many exciting things to do and see in Kedah besides food. The state has a unique blend of history, culture, and natural beauty that are sure to delight visitors of all ages and interests.
